info.title: enfore ERP API
info.description: enfore API for managing products, invoices and credit memos

tags.name: Products
tags.description:
Products are things that are sold by the organization.
They are identified by a unique ID but may have additional identifiers such as a GTIN or ASIN.

tags.name: Products: External ID Mapping
tags.description: All routes that are related to product external to internal ID mappings.

tags.name: Products: Images
tags.description: All routes that are related to product images.

tags.name: Products: Tags
tags.description: All routes that are related to product tags.

tags.name: Products: Sales Channels
tags.description: All routes that are related to the product relationship to a sales channel.

tags.name: Invoices
tags.description:
Invoices are created whenever one or multiple products are sold.
They are created from Orders (which are not available via the API yet) and represent the accounting/ledger-side view of the sale.

tags.name: Credit Memos
tags.description:
Credit memos are created whenever money is returned to a customer.
They are usually created either by voiding a Sales Order (partially or fully) and represent the accounting/ledger-side view of the voiding.

tags.name: Sales Categories
tags.description: Sales categories can be used to categorize resources for sale.

tags.name: DATEV Export
tags.description: Lets you export the content of the account in DATEV format

get.summary: Load the list of all products

parameters.name: org-id
parameters.description: ID of the organization whose data is being accessed.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Max number of objects to be returned per page.
Note that both the `items` as well as the `problems` arrays of the query response count towards this number to allow a simple,
consistent paging over all items (and problems) of a given timeframe.
If not given, defaults to `200`.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Offset of items and problems of where to start the next page.
Similar to limit and offset in SQL, one would obtain the second page with `limit=10&offset=10`.
Note that this paging with limit and offset is within a time interval that is specified with `from` and `to`.
If not given, defaults to `0`.

items.description: The products contained in the sequence

id.description:
The technical identifier of the product. Assigned by the enfore platform on creation of the
product and not changeable afterwards.

name.description: The name of the product.

external_id.description:
An identifier for use by the external system.
Can also be used to address the product via the "/products/external-id/{external-id}" resource.

article_id.description:
The identifier by which the article is addressed by the business when communicating internally
or with customers or suppliers.

Once specified, the article ID cannot be modified anymore. Otherwise, business documents such
as invoices or packaging lists created at different points in time may list the same article
ID for different products.

escrow_supplier.description:
An identifier for use in case the supplied product is an escrow item.
If not present, the product is assumed to be a regular product without any escrow properties.

management_unit.description: Describes a unit of measure. Commonly uses as part of Quantity values.

value.description:
The numerical value of the Money.
Must be in the range of -9,000,000,000,000 to 9,000,000,000,000 and may use up to 6 decimal digits.

unit.description: Represents a currency. Uses the ISO 4217 codes.

price.description: A Money represents a monetary value (i.e., a currency and an amount), for example "120 EUR" or "2,500.75 USD".

price_is_gross.description: Flag indicating whether the price is gross (true) or net (false)

value.description:
The numerical value of the Quantity.
Must be in the range of -9,000,000,000,000 to 9,000,000,000,000 and may use up to 6 decimal digits.

unit.description: Describes a unit of measure. Commonly uses as part of Quantity values.

quantity.description: A Quantity represents a quantity value (i.e., a unit and an amount), for example "3 pcs" or "2.5 kg".

sales_price_and_quantity.description:
The set of information defining the price of a product.
A product's price is always relative to a specific quantity of the product.
For example, if a single bottle of water costs 1�, 5 bottles cost 5�.
Additionally, a given price might be including tax or not.
Therefore, the ProductPriceAndQuantity is a combination of a quantity, a price and a "price is gross"-flag.

block_sales.description: If this optional flag is set to true, selling of the product is blocked.

exclude_from_discounts.description: If this optional flag is set to true, discounts are not applied to this product.

product_identifiers.description:
Additional identifiers such as GTIN or ASIN assigned to the product.
Note that it is possible to have multiple identifiers of the same type.

type.description:
* `ASIN` - Amazon Standard Identification Number (ASIN) - is a 10-character alphanumeric unique identifier assigned by Amazon.com.
* `EAN` - EAN barcode (originally European Article Number) - is a 13 digit (12 data and 1 check) barcoding standard.
* `FNSKU` - Amazon Fulfillment Network SKU - is the unique identifier for each inventory item stored in one of Amazon's fulfillment centers
* `GCID` - Global Catalog Identifier - is number generated by the system automatically after your brand is registered in Amazon.com brand registry
* `GTIN` - Global Trade Item Number - is a globally unique 14-digit number used to identify trade items, products, or services.
* `ISBN` - International Standard Book Number (ISBN) - is a 13-digit number assigned by standard book numbering agencies to control and facilitate activities within the publishing industry.
* `JAN` - Japanese Article Number - is a barcode standard compatible with the International Article Number scheme.
* `UPC` - Universal Product Code (UPC) - is a barcode symbology (i.e., a specific type of barcode) that is widely used in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Australia, New Zealand, and in other countries for tracking trade items in stores.

value.description:
The value of the identifier.
Note that the type imposes constraints on the value, for example a GTIN is between 8 and 14 characters long.

items.description: An identifier for a product. Consists of type and value.

tax_category.description:
Represents the locale-independent representation of a specific type of tax.

The category does not represent a specifix tax. This is needed as taxes are a) different depending
on country (and sometimes even within a single country) and b) tax rates may change over time but
the actual Tax objects must not change as they are referenced by existing invoices.

For example, the tax category STANDARD is mapped to currently mapped to "DE/19%" for Germany and to "UK/20%"
for the UK. If Germany would increase the standard tax rate to 21%, the mapping for Germany would be updated,
but the products would still use the same STANDARD category as before.

Additional factors may also influcence the mapping, for example the category REDUCED_TAKE_AWAY normally gets
mapped to "DE/19%" for Germany. But when the sale is flagged as "to go", the category is mapped to "DE/7%"
instead.

tax_exemption_reason.description: Reasons for not applying tax on a product sale.

provider_id.description:
The identifier of the provider for the custom workflows related
to the product.

configure_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "configure line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time the
product is selected in the register grid (or scanned, or
added via search) instead of the regular N4 handling for
creation of the line item.

assemble_product_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "assemble product" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked as part of order
processing every time a line item with the product is
fully paid. This then replaces the regular N4 handling
for assembling products.

cancel_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "cancel line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time an
unpaid line item with the product is removed from an order.
This replaces the regular N4 UI for selection of the
cancelation reason.

NOTE: This also assumes the item will always be canceled
in full. I.e., no partial cancel operations.

refund_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "refund line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time a
paid line item with the product is removed from an order.
This replaces the regular N4 UI for selection of the
cancelation reason.

NOTE: This currently assumes that items will always simply
be refunded. No "repair", "replace", or "return" handling
is supported for items with such a workflow.

NOTE: This also assumes the item will always be refunded
in full. I.e., no partial refunds.

custom_workflow_config.description:
Holds information about the custom workflows defined for a
product and the line items of orders/invoices that reference
the product.

sales_category.description: The ID of the sales category that the product belongs to.

track_inventory.description: Flag that specifies if inventory (per storage location) is tracked for the product.

manufacturer.description: The name of the manufacturer of the product.

require_lot_for_sales_fulfillment.description:
Flag indicating whether a lot must be specified when a sales is fulfilled.

When TRUE, a lot must be specified in the register (for OTC sales) or during
pickup/delivery fulfillment.

lot_configuration.description:
Defines that the product uses lots and provides the settings on how
lots are used.

items.description: Represents a product that is sold by the business.

problems.description: Any problems that occurred when handling the query

type.description: A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.

title.description:
A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.
Note that this is not specific to the specific problem occurrence but only depends on the type.
Target audience is developers using the API, not suitable for display to end users.

detail.description:
A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
Target audience is developers using the API, not suitable for display to end users.

on_resource.description: URI of the resource for which the error occurred.

items.description:
A problem that occurred while processing an API request.
This is based on problem+json as defined in [RFC7807](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7807)
Will have a textual message that is intended for use by developers using the API and not usable for display to end users.
If the error occurred as part of operating on a specific resource, the object may provide the URI idenifying that object.

schema.description: A list of products together with any problems that occurred.

get.summary: Load a product by its identifier

parameters.name: org-id
parameters.description: ID of the organization whose data is being accessed.

parameters.name: product-id
parameters.description: ID of the product to load, create or update

id.description:
The technical identifier of the product. Assigned by the enfore platform on creation of the
product and not changeable afterwards.

name.description: The name of the product.

external_id.description:
An identifier for use by the external system.
Can also be used to address the product via the "/products/external-id/{external-id}" resource.

article_id.description:
The identifier by which the article is addressed by the business when communicating internally
or with customers or suppliers.

Once specified, the article ID cannot be modified anymore. Otherwise, business documents such
as invoices or packaging lists created at different points in time may list the same article
ID for different products.

escrow_supplier.description:
An identifier for use in case the supplied product is an escrow item.
If not present, the product is assumed to be a regular product without any escrow properties.

management_unit.description: Describes a unit of measure. Commonly uses as part of Quantity values.

value.description:
The numerical value of the Money.
Must be in the range of -9,000,000,000,000 to 9,000,000,000,000 and may use up to 6 decimal digits.

unit.description: Represents a currency. Uses the ISO 4217 codes.

price.description: A Money represents a monetary value (i.e., a currency and an amount), for example "120 EUR" or "2,500.75 USD".

price_is_gross.description: Flag indicating whether the price is gross (true) or net (false)

value.description:
The numerical value of the Quantity.
Must be in the range of -9,000,000,000,000 to 9,000,000,000,000 and may use up to 6 decimal digits.

unit.description: Describes a unit of measure. Commonly uses as part of Quantity values.

quantity.description: A Quantity represents a quantity value (i.e., a unit and an amount), for example "3 pcs" or "2.5 kg".

sales_price_and_quantity.description:
The set of information defining the price of a product.
A product's price is always relative to a specific quantity of the product.
For example, if a single bottle of water costs 1�, 5 bottles cost 5�.
Additionally, a given price might be including tax or not.
Therefore, the ProductPriceAndQuantity is a combination of a quantity, a price and a "price is gross"-flag.

block_sales.description: If this optional flag is set to true, selling of the product is blocked.

exclude_from_discounts.description: If this optional flag is set to true, discounts are not applied to this product.

product_identifiers.description:
Additional identifiers such as GTIN or ASIN assigned to the product.
Note that it is possible to have multiple identifiers of the same type.

type.description:
* `ASIN` - Amazon Standard Identification Number (ASIN) - is a 10-character alphanumeric unique identifier assigned by Amazon.com.
* `EAN` - EAN barcode (originally European Article Number) - is a 13 digit (12 data and 1 check) barcoding standard.
* `FNSKU` - Amazon Fulfillment Network SKU - is the unique identifier for each inventory item stored in one of Amazon's fulfillment centers
* `GCID` - Global Catalog Identifier - is number generated by the system automatically after your brand is registered in Amazon.com brand registry
* `GTIN` - Global Trade Item Number - is a globally unique 14-digit number used to identify trade items, products, or services.
* `ISBN` - International Standard Book Number (ISBN) - is a 13-digit number assigned by standard book numbering agencies to control and facilitate activities within the publishing industry.
* `JAN` - Japanese Article Number - is a barcode standard compatible with the International Article Number scheme.
* `UPC` - Universal Product Code (UPC) - is a barcode symbology (i.e., a specific type of barcode) that is widely used in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Australia, New Zealand, and in other countries for tracking trade items in stores.

value.description:
The value of the identifier.
Note that the type imposes constraints on the value, for example a GTIN is between 8 and 14 characters long.

items.description: An identifier for a product. Consists of type and value.

tax_category.description:
Represents the locale-independent representation of a specific type of tax.

The category does not represent a specifix tax. This is needed as taxes are a) different depending
on country (and sometimes even within a single country) and b) tax rates may change over time but
the actual Tax objects must not change as they are referenced by existing invoices.

For example, the tax category STANDARD is mapped to currently mapped to "DE/19%" for Germany and to "UK/20%"
for the UK. If Germany would increase the standard tax rate to 21%, the mapping for Germany would be updated,
but the products would still use the same STANDARD category as before.

Additional factors may also influcence the mapping, for example the category REDUCED_TAKE_AWAY normally gets
mapped to "DE/19%" for Germany. But when the sale is flagged as "to go", the category is mapped to "DE/7%"
instead.

tax_exemption_reason.description: Reasons for not applying tax on a product sale.

provider_id.description:
The identifier of the provider for the custom workflows related
to the product.

configure_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "configure line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time the
product is selected in the register grid (or scanned, or
added via search) instead of the regular N4 handling for
creation of the line item.

assemble_product_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "assemble product" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked as part of order
processing every time a line item with the product is
fully paid. This then replaces the regular N4 handling
for assembling products.

cancel_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "cancel line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time an
unpaid line item with the product is removed from an order.
This replaces the regular N4 UI for selection of the
cancelation reason.

NOTE: This also assumes the item will always be canceled
in full. I.e., no partial cancel operations.

refund_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "refund line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time a
paid line item with the product is removed from an order.
This replaces the regular N4 UI for selection of the
cancelation reason.

NOTE: This currently assumes that items will always simply
be refunded. No "repair", "replace", or "return" handling
is supported for items with such a workflow.

NOTE: This also assumes the item will always be refunded
in full. I.e., no partial refunds.

custom_workflow_config.description:
Holds information about the custom workflows defined for a
product and the line items of orders/invoices that reference
the product.

sales_category.description: The ID of the sales category that the product belongs to.

track_inventory.description: Flag that specifies if inventory (per storage location) is tracked for the product.

manufacturer.description: The name of the manufacturer of the product.

require_lot_for_sales_fulfillment.description:
Flag indicating whether a lot must be specified when a sales is fulfilled.

When TRUE, a lot must be specified in the register (for OTC sales) or during
pickup/delivery fulfillment.

lot_configuration.description:
Defines that the product uses lots and provides the settings on how
lots are used.

schema.description: Represents a product that is sold by the business.

for the UK. If Germany would increase the standard tax rate to 21%, the mapping for Germany would be updated,
but the products would still use the same STANDARD category as before.

Additional factors may also influcence the mapping, for example the category REDUCED_TAKE_AWAY normally gets
mapped to "DE/19%" for Germany. But when the sale is flagged as "to go", the category is mapped to "DE/7%"
instead.

tax_exemption_reason.description: Reasons for not applying tax on a product sale.

provider_id.description:
The identifier of the provider for the custom workflows related
to the product.

configure_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "configure line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time the
product is selected in the register grid (or scanned, or
added via search) instead of the regular N4 handling for
creation of the line item.

assemble_product_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "assemble product" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked as part of order
processing every time a line item with the product is
fully paid. This then replaces the regular N4 handling
for assembling products.

cancel_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "cancel line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time an
unpaid line item with the product is removed from an order.
This replaces the regular N4 UI for selection of the
cancelation reason.

NOTE: This also assumes the item will always be canceled
in full. I.e., no partial cancel operations.

refund_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "refund line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time a
paid line item with the product is removed from an order.
This replaces the regular N4 UI for selection of the
cancelation reason.

NOTE: This currently assumes that items will always simply
be refunded. No "repair", "replace", or "return" handling
is supported for items with such a workflow.

NOTE: This also assumes the item will always be refunded
in full. I.e., no partial refunds.

custom_workflow_config.description:
Holds information about the custom workflows defined for a
product and the line items of orders/invoices that reference
the product.

sales_category.description: The ID of the sales category that the product belongs to.

track_inventory.description: Flag that specifies if inventory (per storage location) is tracked for the product.

manufacturer.description: The name of the manufacturer of the product.

require_lot_for_sales_fulfillment.description:
Flag indicating whether a lot must be specified when a sales is fulfilled.

When TRUE, a lot must be specified in the register (for OTC sales) or during
pickup/delivery fulfillment.

lot_configuration.description:
Defines that the product uses lots and provides the settings on how
lots are used.

schema.description: Represents a product that is sold by the business.

get.summary: Load all sales channel-specific information of a product identified by its ID

parameters.name: org-id
parameters.description: ID of the organization whose data is being accessed.

parameters.name: product-id
parameters.description: ID of the product to load, create or update

200.description: Sales Channel Informations are successfully returned

id.description: The technical identifier of the product's sales channel information. Assigned by the enfore platform.

sales_channel_id.description: The technical identifier of the sales channel.

value.description:
The numerical value of the Money.
Must be in the range of -9,000,000,000,000 to 9,000,000,000,000 and may use up to 6 decimal digits.

unit.description: Represents a currency. Uses the ISO 4217 codes.

price.description: A Money represents a monetary value (i.e., a currency and an amount), for example "120 EUR" or "2,500.75 USD".

price_is_gross.description: Flag indicating whether the price is gross (true) or net (false)

value.description:
The numerical value of the Quantity.
Must be in the range of -9,000,000,000,000 to 9,000,000,000,000 and may use up to 6 decimal digits.

unit.description: Describes a unit of measure. Commonly uses as part of Quantity values.

quantity.description: A Quantity represents a quantity value (i.e., a unit and an amount), for example "3 pcs" or "2.5 kg".

sales_price_and_quantity.description:
The set of information defining the price of a product.
A product's price is always relative to a specific quantity of the product.
For example, if a single bottle of water costs 1�, 5 bottles cost 5�.
Additionally, a given price might be including tax or not.
Therefore, the ProductPriceAndQuantity is a combination of a quantity, a price and a "price is gross"-flag.

block_sales.description: Whether sales of the product are allowed on the sales channel. When not specified, the product's configuration is used instead.

exclude_from_discounts.description: Whether discounts may be applied when the product is sold on the sales channel. When not specified, the product's configuration is used instead.

items.description:
Information about the product for a specific sales channel.
Sales channels represent a place where the products can be sold.
Each ProductSalesChannelInformation holds the information relevant for the sale of the product on a specific channel.
When no ProductSalesChannelInformation exists for a specfic product and channel, that product cannot be sold via that channel.

get.summary: Load a product by its external ID

parameters.name: org-id
parameters.description: ID of the organization whose data is being accessed.

parameters.name: external-id
parameters.description: External ID of the product to load, create or update

id.description:
The technical identifier of the product. Assigned by the enfore platform on creation of the
product and not changeable afterwards.

name.description: The name of the product.

external_id.description:
An identifier for use by the external system.
Can also be used to address the product via the "/products/external-id/{external-id}" resource.

article_id.description:
The identifier by which the article is addressed by the business when communicating internally
or with customers or suppliers.

Once specified, the article ID cannot be modified anymore. Otherwise, business documents such
as invoices or packaging lists created at different points in time may list the same article
ID for different products.

escrow_supplier.description:
An identifier for use in case the supplied product is an escrow item.
If not present, the product is assumed to be a regular product without any escrow properties.

management_unit.description: Describes a unit of measure. Commonly uses as part of Quantity values.

value.description:
The numerical value of the Money.
Must be in the range of -9,000,000,000,000 to 9,000,000,000,000 and may use up to 6 decimal digits.

unit.description: Represents a currency. Uses the ISO 4217 codes.

price.description: A Money represents a monetary value (i.e., a currency and an amount), for example "120 EUR" or "2,500.75 USD".

price_is_gross.description: Flag indicating whether the price is gross (true) or net (false)

value.description:
The numerical value of the Quantity.
Must be in the range of -9,000,000,000,000 to 9,000,000,000,000 and may use up to 6 decimal digits.

unit.description: Describes a unit of measure. Commonly uses as part of Quantity values.

quantity.description: A Quantity represents a quantity value (i.e., a unit and an amount), for example "3 pcs" or "2.5 kg".

sales_price_and_quantity.description:
The set of information defining the price of a product.
A product's price is always relative to a specific quantity of the product.
For example, if a single bottle of water costs 1�, 5 bottles cost 5�.
Additionally, a given price might be including tax or not.
Therefore, the ProductPriceAndQuantity is a combination of a quantity, a price and a "price is gross"-flag.

block_sales.description: If this optional flag is set to true, selling of the product is blocked.

exclude_from_discounts.description: If this optional flag is set to true, discounts are not applied to this product.

product_identifiers.description:
Additional identifiers such as GTIN or ASIN assigned to the product.
Note that it is possible to have multiple identifiers of the same type.

type.description:
* `ASIN` - Amazon Standard Identification Number (ASIN) - is a 10-character alphanumeric unique identifier assigned by Amazon.com.
* `EAN` - EAN barcode (originally European Article Number) - is a 13 digit (12 data and 1 check) barcoding standard.
* `FNSKU` - Amazon Fulfillment Network SKU - is the unique identifier for each inventory item stored in one of Amazon's fulfillment centers
* `GCID` - Global Catalog Identifier - is number generated by the system automatically after your brand is registered in Amazon.com brand registry
* `GTIN` - Global Trade Item Number - is a globally unique 14-digit number used to identify trade items, products, or services.
* `ISBN` - International Standard Book Number (ISBN) - is a 13-digit number assigned by standard book numbering agencies to control and facilitate activities within the publishing industry.
* `JAN` - Japanese Article Number - is a barcode standard compatible with the International Article Number scheme.
* `UPC` - Universal Product Code (UPC) - is a barcode symbology (i.e., a specific type of barcode) that is widely used in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Australia, New Zealand, and in other countries for tracking trade items in stores.

value.description:
The value of the identifier.
Note that the type imposes constraints on the value, for example a GTIN is between 8 and 14 characters long.

items.description: An identifier for a product. Consists of type and value.

tax_category.description:
Represents the locale-independent representation of a specific type of tax.

The category does not represent a specifix tax. This is needed as taxes are a) different depending
on country (and sometimes even within a single country) and b) tax rates may change over time but
the actual Tax objects must not change as they are referenced by existing invoices.

For example, the tax category STANDARD is mapped to currently mapped to "DE/19%" for Germany and to "UK/20%"
for the UK. If Germany would increase the standard tax rate to 21%, the mapping for Germany would be updated,
but the products would still use the same STANDARD category as before.

Additional factors may also influcence the mapping, for example the category REDUCED_TAKE_AWAY normally gets
mapped to "DE/19%" for Germany. But when the sale is flagged as "to go", the category is mapped to "DE/7%"
instead.

tax_exemption_reason.description: Reasons for not applying tax on a product sale.

provider_id.description:
The identifier of the provider for the custom workflows related
to the product.

configure_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "configure line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time the
product is selected in the register grid (or scanned, or
added via search) instead of the regular N4 handling for
creation of the line item.

assemble_product_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "assemble product" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked as part of order
processing every time a line item with the product is
fully paid. This then replaces the regular N4 handling
for assembling products.

cancel_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "cancel line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time an
unpaid line item with the product is removed from an order.
This replaces the regular N4 UI for selection of the
cancelation reason.

NOTE: This also assumes the item will always be canceled
in full. I.e., no partial cancel operations.

refund_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "refund line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time a
paid line item with the product is removed from an order.
This replaces the regular N4 UI for selection of the
cancelation reason.

NOTE: This currently assumes that items will always simply
be refunded. No "repair", "replace", or "return" handling
is supported for items with such a workflow.

NOTE: This also assumes the item will always be refunded
in full. I.e., no partial refunds.

custom_workflow_config.description:
Holds information about the custom workflows defined for a
product and the line items of orders/invoices that reference
the product.

sales_category.description: The ID of the sales category that the product belongs to.

track_inventory.description: Flag that specifies if inventory (per storage location) is tracked for the product.

manufacturer.description: The name of the manufacturer of the product.

require_lot_for_sales_fulfillment.description:
Flag indicating whether a lot must be specified when a sales is fulfilled.

When TRUE, a lot must be specified in the register (for OTC sales) or during
pickup/delivery fulfillment.

lot_configuration.description:
Defines that the product uses lots and provides the settings on how
lots are used.

schema.description: Represents a product that is sold by the business.

The set of information defining the price of a product.
A product's price is always relative to a specific quantity of the product.
For example, if a single bottle of water costs 1�, 5 bottles cost 5�.
Additionally, a given price might be including tax or not.
Therefore, the ProductPriceAndQuantity is a combination of a quantity, a price and a "price is gross"-flag.

block_sales.description: If this optional flag is set to true, selling of the product is blocked.

exclude_from_discounts.description: If this optional flag is set to true, discounts are not applied to this product.

product_identifiers.description:
Additional identifiers such as GTIN or ASIN assigned to the product.
Note that it is possible to have multiple identifiers of the same type.

type.description:
* `ASIN` - Amazon Standard Identification Number (ASIN) - is a 10-character alphanumeric unique identifier assigned by Amazon.com.
* `EAN` - EAN barcode (originally European Article Number) - is a 13 digit (12 data and 1 check) barcoding standard.
* `FNSKU` - Amazon Fulfillment Network SKU - is the unique identifier for each inventory item stored in one of Amazon's fulfillment centers
* `GCID` - Global Catalog Identifier - is number generated by the system automatically after your brand is registered in Amazon.com brand registry
* `GTIN` - Global Trade Item Number - is a globally unique 14-digit number used to identify trade items, products, or services.
* `ISBN` - International Standard Book Number (ISBN) - is a 13-digit number assigned by standard book numbering agencies to control and facilitate activities within the publishing industry.
* `JAN` - Japanese Article Number - is a barcode standard compatible with the International Article Number scheme.
* `UPC` - Universal Product Code (UPC) - is a barcode symbology (i.e., a specific type of barcode) that is widely used in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Australia, New Zealand, and in other countries for tracking trade items in stores.

value.description:
The value of the identifier.
Note that the type imposes constraints on the value, for example a GTIN is between 8 and 14 characters long.

items.description: An identifier for a product. Consists of type and value.

tax_category.description:
Represents the locale-independent representation of a specific type of tax.

The category does not represent a specifix tax. This is needed as taxes are a) different depending
on country (and sometimes even within a single country) and b) tax rates may change over time but
the actual Tax objects must not change as they are referenced by existing invoices.

For example, the tax category STANDARD is mapped to currently mapped to "DE/19%" for Germany and to "UK/20%"
for the UK. If Germany would increase the standard tax rate to 21%, the mapping for Germany would be updated,
but the products would still use the same STANDARD category as before.

Additional factors may also influcence the mapping, for example the category REDUCED_TAKE_AWAY normally gets
mapped to "DE/19%" for Germany. But when the sale is flagged as "to go", the category is mapped to "DE/7%"
instead.

tax_exemption_reason.description: Reasons for not applying tax on a product sale.

provider_id.description:
The identifier of the provider for the custom workflows related
to the product.

configure_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "configure line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time the
product is selected in the register grid (or scanned, or
added via search) instead of the regular N4 handling for
creation of the line item.

assemble_product_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "assemble product" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked as part of order
processing every time a line item with the product is
fully paid. This then replaces the regular N4 handling
for assembling products.

cancel_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "cancel line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time an
unpaid line item with the product is removed from an order.
This replaces the regular N4 UI for selection of the
cancelation reason.

NOTE: This also assumes the item will always be canceled
in full. I.e., no partial cancel operations.

refund_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "refund line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time a
paid line item with the product is removed from an order.
This replaces the regular N4 UI for selection of the
cancelation reason.

NOTE: This currently assumes that items will always simply
be refunded. No "repair", "replace", or "return" handling
is supported for items with such a workflow.

NOTE: This also assumes the item will always be refunded
in full. I.e., no partial refunds.

custom_workflow_config.description:
Holds information about the custom workflows defined for a
product and the line items of orders/invoices that reference
the product.

sales_category.description: The ID of the sales category that the product belongs to.

track_inventory.description: Flag that specifies if inventory (per storage location) is tracked for the product.

manufacturer.description: The name of the manufacturer of the product.

require_lot_for_sales_fulfillment.description:
Flag indicating whether a lot must be specified when a sales is fulfilled.

When TRUE, a lot must be specified in the register (for OTC sales) or during
pickup/delivery fulfillment.

lot_configuration.description:
Defines that the product uses lots and provides the settings on how
lots are used.

schema.description: Represents a product that is sold by the business.

id.description:
The technical identifier of the product. Assigned by the enfore platform on creation of the
product and not changeable afterwards.

name.description: The name of the product.

external_id.description:
An identifier for use by the external system.
Can also be used to address the product via the "/products/external-id/{external-id}" resource.

article_id.description:
The identifier by which the article is addressed by the business when communicating internally
or with customers or suppliers.

Once specified, the article ID cannot be modified anymore. Otherwise, business documents such
as invoices or packaging lists created at different points in time may list the same article
ID for different products.

escrow_supplier.description:
An identifier for use in case the supplied product is an escrow item.
If not present, the product is assumed to be a regular product without any escrow properties.

management_unit.description: Describes a unit of measure. Commonly uses as part of Quantity values.

value.description:
The numerical value of the Money.
Must be in the range of -9,000,000,000,000 to 9,000,000,000,000 and may use up to 6 decimal digits.

unit.description: Represents a currency. Uses the ISO 4217 codes.

price.description: A Money represents a monetary value (i.e., a currency and an amount), for example "120 EUR" or "2,500.75 USD".

price_is_gross.description: Flag indicating whether the price is gross (true) or net (false)

get.summary: Returns IDs of all the images that are attached to this product

parameters.name: org-id
parameters.description: ID of the organization whose data is being accessed.

parameters.name: product-id
parameters.description: ID of the product that is the subject of the request

200.description: Successfully returns the list of identifiers

ids.description:
An ordered list of strings representing identifiers of some sort.
The list is ordered by the time at which the item was added. The last added item appears first in the list.

schema.description: A container for a set containing identifiers of some sort

post.summary: Add a new image to the product.
post.description:
This method appends a new image to the list of images that are attached
to a given product.
Note that every time you add an image, it is appended to the front of the list such that
it becomes the default image.
Note that at the moment only JPEG and PNG images are supported. A request size restriction may also be imposed by the gateway. Typically, the gateway limits requests over 12 Megabytes.

parameters.name: org-id
parameters.description: ID of the organization whose data is being accessed.

parameters.name: product-id
parameters.description: ID of the product that is the subject of the request

data.description: A Base64 encoded string containing the image binary

schema.description: A container for the requests for adding an image to a product

200.description: Successfully added the image to the product

id.description: A string representing an identifier

schema.description: A container for a single identifier of some sort

delete.summary: Delete an image by it's identifier on a given product

parameters.name: org-id
parameters.description: ID of the organization whose data is being accessed.

parameters.name: product-id
parameters.description: ID of the product that is the subject of the request

parameters.name: image-id
parameters.description: ID of the image that needs to be deleted

204.description: Successfully removed the image that was to be removed

parameters.name: org-id
parameters.description: ID of the organization whose data is being accessed.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Max number of objects to be returned per page.
Note that both the `items` as well as the `problems` arrays of the query response count towards this number to allow a simple,
consistent paging over all items (and problems) of a given timeframe.
If not given, defaults to `200`.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Offset of items and problems of where to start the next page.
Similar to limit and offset in SQL, one would obtain the second page with `limit=10&offset=10`.
Note that this paging with limit and offset is within a time interval that is specified with `from` and `to`.
If not given, defaults to `0`.

get.summary: Get a list with all sales categories sorted by their names.

parameters.name: org-id
parameters.description: ID of the organization whose data is being accessed.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Max number of objects to be returned per page.
Note that both the `items` as well as the `problems` arrays of the query response count towards this number to allow a simple,
consistent paging over all items (and problems) of a given timeframe.
If not given, defaults to `200`.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Offset of items and problems of where to start the next page.
Similar to limit and offset in SQL, one would obtain the second page with `limit=10&offset=10`.
Note that this paging with limit and offset is within a time interval that is specified with `from` and `to`.
If not given, defaults to `0`.

get.description:
Returns invoices for the specified interval, sorted in ascending order by transaction date and time.

Since our platform was built as a distributed system, we are subject to the laws of the "Eventual consistency" model. This means that time periods close to the present may be unstable and could contain new items if the same time interval is queried again.

We therefore recommend that intervals that are close to the present time should be re-requested and verified at a later time.

parameters.name: org-id
parameters.description: ID of the organization whose data is being accessed.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
Defines the time starting from which objects are to be returned.
Objects with exactly this date are also returned - this means that the start of a left-closed interval is defined.
Timestamp in UTC. The date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339 (https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt), section 5.6, with the "Z" as time-offset. For example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28.123Z

parameters.name: to
parameters.description:
Defines the time up to which objects are to be returned.
Objects with exactly this date are not returned - this means that the end of a right-open interval is defined.
Timestamp in UTC. The date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339 (https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt), section 5.6, with the "Z" as time-offset. For example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28.123Z

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Max number of objects to be returned per page.
Note that both the `items` as well as the `problems` arrays of the query response count towards this number to allow a simple,
consistent paging over all items (and problems) of a given timeframe.
If not given, defaults to `200`.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Offset of items and problems of where to start the next page.
Similar to limit and offset in SQL, one would obtain the second page with `limit=10&offset=10`.
Note that this paging with limit and offset is within a time interval that is specified with `from` and `to`.
If not given, defaults to `0`.

taxes.description: List of taxes that were applied to the item

items.description:
A Tax represents a specific and unchangeable tax. Whenever a tax (rate) changes due to new legislation
or other reasons, a new Tax must be defined and used from then on.

For example, the standard VAT rates in Germany have been changed multiple times in the last 50 years:
* 01.01.1968 � 30.06.1968 = 10%
* 01.07.1968 � 31.12.1977 = 11%
* 01.01.1978 � 30.06.1979 = 12%
* 01.07.1979 � 30.06.1983 = 13%
* 01.07.1983 � 31.12.1992 = 14%
* 01.01.1993 � 31.03.1998 = 15%
* 01.04.1998 � 31.12.2006 = 16%
* 01.01.2007 � current    = 19%

For now, we only use the tax DE_STANDARD_VAT_2007. But if, hypothetically, Germany would increase its
standard VAT rate to 21% on 1/JAN/2020, we would define a new tax DE_STANDARD_VAT_2020 and use that from
1/JAN/2020 on.

depending_items.description:
List of items that depend on this item.

An item depends on another item, if it cannot exist alone. There are different types
of dependencies, therefore each element in the list is a pair of the id of the depending
item and the type of the dependency.

depending_item_id.description: The ID of the depending item.

dependency_type.description:
Defines the different types of dependencies that can exist between invoice items.

* UNKNOWN - The dependency type is not known
* OPTION - The depending item is an option of its dependee
* DEPOSIT - The depending item is a deposit item of its dependee
* CONTENT_COMPOSITION - The depending item describes the content of its dependee
* PRICING_COMPOSITION - The depending item describes how the price of its dependee is determined

external_pricing_data.description:
When the item's price was computed by an external pricing engine
and that engine did provide "external data" as part of its result,
that data is provided here.

post.summary: Register an event consumer with the API.
post.description:
If the callback URL is already registered, we return the original subscription ID.
We will continue attempting to send new items to registered subscriptions until they are deleted.
In case we cannot reach the endpoint, we will apply an exponential backoff.

taxes.description: List of taxes that were applied to the item

items.description:
A Tax represents a specific and unchangeable tax. Whenever a tax (rate) changes due to new legislation
or other reasons, a new Tax must be defined and used from then on.

For example, the standard VAT rates in Germany have been changed multiple times in the last 50 years:
* 01.01.1968 � 30.06.1968 = 10%
* 01.07.1968 � 31.12.1977 = 11%
* 01.01.1978 � 30.06.1979 = 12%
* 01.07.1979 � 30.06.1983 = 13%
* 01.07.1983 � 31.12.1992 = 14%
* 01.01.1993 � 31.03.1998 = 15%
* 01.04.1998 � 31.12.2006 = 16%
* 01.01.2007 � current    = 19%

For now, we only use the tax DE_STANDARD_VAT_2007. But if, hypothetically, Germany would increase its
standard VAT rate to 21% on 1/JAN/2020, we would define a new tax DE_STANDARD_VAT_2020 and use that from
1/JAN/2020 on.

depending_items.description:
List of items that depend on this item.

An item depends on another item, if it cannot exist alone. There are different types
of dependencies, therefore each element in the list is a pair of the id of the depending
item and the type of the dependency.

depending_item_id.description: The ID of the depending item.

dependency_type.description:
Defines the different types of dependencies that can exist between invoice items.

* UNKNOWN - The dependency type is not known
* OPTION - The depending item is an option of its dependee
* DEPOSIT - The depending item is a deposit item of its dependee
* CONTENT_COMPOSITION - The depending item describes the content of its dependee
* PRICING_COMPOSITION - The depending item describes how the price of its dependee is determined

external_pricing_data.description:
When the item's price was computed by an external pricing engine
and that engine did provide "external data" as part of its result,
that data is provided here.

get.description: Returns credit memos for the specified interval, sorted in ascending order by transaction date and time.

parameters.name: org-id
parameters.description: ID of the organization whose data is being accessed.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
Defines the time starting from which objects are to be returned.
Objects with exactly this date are also returned - this means that the start of a left-closed interval is defined.
Timestamp in UTC. The date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339 (https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt), section 5.6, with the "Z" as time-offset. For example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28.123Z

parameters.name: to
parameters.description:
Defines the time up to which objects are to be returned.
Objects with exactly this date are not returned - this means that the end of a right-open interval is defined.
Timestamp in UTC. The date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339 (https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt), section 5.6, with the "Z" as time-offset. For example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28.123Z

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Max number of objects to be returned per page.
Note that both the `items` as well as the `problems` arrays of the query response count towards this number to allow a simple,
consistent paging over all items (and problems) of a given timeframe.
If not given, defaults to `200`.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Offset of items and problems of where to start the next page.
Similar to limit and offset in SQL, one would obtain the second page with `limit=10&offset=10`.
Note that this paging with limit and offset is within a time interval that is specified with `from` and `to`.
If not given, defaults to `0`.

taxes.description: List of taxes that were applied to the item

items.description:
A Tax represents a specific and unchangeable tax. Whenever a tax (rate) changes due to new legislation
or other reasons, a new Tax must be defined and used from then on.

For example, the standard VAT rates in Germany have been changed multiple times in the last 50 years:
* 01.01.1968 � 30.06.1968 = 10%
* 01.07.1968 � 31.12.1977 = 11%
* 01.01.1978 � 30.06.1979 = 12%
* 01.07.1979 � 30.06.1983 = 13%
* 01.07.1983 � 31.12.1992 = 14%
* 01.01.1993 � 31.03.1998 = 15%
* 01.04.1998 � 31.12.2006 = 16%
* 01.01.2007 � current    = 19%

For now, we only use the tax DE_STANDARD_VAT_2007. But if, hypothetically, Germany would increase its
standard VAT rate to 21% on 1/JAN/2020, we would define a new tax DE_STANDARD_VAT_2020 and use that from
1/JAN/2020 on.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
Defines the time starting from which objects are to be returned.
Objects with exactly this date are also returned - this means that the start of a left-closed interval is defined.
Timestamp in UTC. The date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339 (https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt), section 5.6, with the "Z" as time-offset. For example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28.123Z

Defines the time up to which objects are to be returned.
Objects with exactly this date are not returned - this means that the end of a right-open interval is defined.
Timestamp in UTC. The date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339 (https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt), section 5.6, with the "Z" as time-offset. For example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28.123Z

items.description: The products contained in the sequence

id.description:
The technical identifier of the product. Assigned by the enfore platform on creation of the
product and not changeable afterwards.

name.description: The name of the product.

external_id.description:
An identifier for use by the external system.
Can also be used to address the product via the "/products/external-id/{external-id}" resource.

article_id.description:
The identifier by which the article is addressed by the business when communicating internally
or with customers or suppliers.

Once specified, the article ID cannot be modified anymore. Otherwise, business documents such
as invoices or packaging lists created at different points in time may list the same article
ID for different products.

escrow_supplier.description:
An identifier for use in case the supplied product is an escrow item.
If not present, the product is assumed to be a regular product without any escrow properties.

management_unit.description: Describes a unit of measure. Commonly uses as part of Quantity values.

value.description:
The numerical value of the Money.
Must be in the range of -9,000,000,000,000 to 9,000,000,000,000 and may use up to 6 decimal digits.

unit.description: Represents a currency. Uses the ISO 4217 codes.

price.description: A Money represents a monetary value (i.e., a currency and an amount), for example "120 EUR" or "2,500.75 USD".

price_is_gross.description: Flag indicating whether the price is gross (true) or net (false)

value.description:
The numerical value of the Quantity.
Must be in the range of -9,000,000,000,000 to 9,000,000,000,000 and may use up to 6 decimal digits.

unit.description: Describes a unit of measure. Commonly uses as part of Quantity values.

quantity.description: A Quantity represents a quantity value (i.e., a unit and an amount), for example "3 pcs" or "2.5 kg".

sales_price_and_quantity.description:
The set of information defining the price of a product.
A product's price is always relative to a specific quantity of the product.
For example, if a single bottle of water costs 1�, 5 bottles cost 5�.
Additionally, a given price might be including tax or not.
Therefore, the ProductPriceAndQuantity is a combination of a quantity, a price and a "price is gross"-flag.

block_sales.description: If this optional flag is set to true, selling of the product is blocked.

exclude_from_discounts.description: If this optional flag is set to true, discounts are not applied to this product.

product_identifiers.description:
Additional identifiers such as GTIN or ASIN assigned to the product.
Note that it is possible to have multiple identifiers of the same type.

type.description:
* `ASIN` - Amazon Standard Identification Number (ASIN) - is a 10-character alphanumeric unique identifier assigned by Amazon.com.
* `EAN` - EAN barcode (originally European Article Number) - is a 13 digit (12 data and 1 check) barcoding standard.
* `FNSKU` - Amazon Fulfillment Network SKU - is the unique identifier for each inventory item stored in one of Amazon's fulfillment centers
* `GCID` - Global Catalog Identifier - is number generated by the system automatically after your brand is registered in Amazon.com brand registry
* `GTIN` - Global Trade Item Number - is a globally unique 14-digit number used to identify trade items, products, or services.
* `ISBN` - International Standard Book Number (ISBN) - is a 13-digit number assigned by standard book numbering agencies to control and facilitate activities within the publishing industry.
* `JAN` - Japanese Article Number - is a barcode standard compatible with the International Article Number scheme.
* `UPC` - Universal Product Code (UPC) - is a barcode symbology (i.e., a specific type of barcode) that is widely used in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Australia, New Zealand, and in other countries for tracking trade items in stores.

value.description:
The value of the identifier.
Note that the type imposes constraints on the value, for example a GTIN is between 8 and 14 characters long.

items.description: An identifier for a product. Consists of type and value.

tax_category.description:
Represents the locale-independent representation of a specific type of tax.

The category does not represent a specifix tax. This is needed as taxes are a) different depending
on country (and sometimes even within a single country) and b) tax rates may change over time but
the actual Tax objects must not change as they are referenced by existing invoices.

For example, the tax category STANDARD is mapped to currently mapped to "DE/19%" for Germany and to "UK/20%"
for the UK. If Germany would increase the standard tax rate to 21%, the mapping for Germany would be updated,
but the products would still use the same STANDARD category as before.

Additional factors may also influcence the mapping, for example the category REDUCED_TAKE_AWAY normally gets
mapped to "DE/19%" for Germany. But when the sale is flagged as "to go", the category is mapped to "DE/7%"
instead.

tax_exemption_reason.description: Reasons for not applying tax on a product sale.

provider_id.description:
The identifier of the provider for the custom workflows related
to the product.

configure_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "configure line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time the
product is selected in the register grid (or scanned, or
added via search) instead of the regular N4 handling for
creation of the line item.

assemble_product_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "assemble product" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked as part of order
processing every time a line item with the product is
fully paid. This then replaces the regular N4 handling
for assembling products.

cancel_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "cancel line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time an
unpaid line item with the product is removed from an order.
This replaces the regular N4 UI for selection of the
cancelation reason.

NOTE: This also assumes the item will always be canceled
in full. I.e., no partial cancel operations.

refund_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "refund line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time a
paid line item with the product is removed from an order.
This replaces the regular N4 UI for selection of the
cancelation reason.

NOTE: This currently assumes that items will always simply
be refunded. No "repair", "replace", or "return" handling
is supported for items with such a workflow.

NOTE: This also assumes the item will always be refunded
in full. I.e., no partial refunds.

custom_workflow_config.description:
Holds information about the custom workflows defined for a
product and the line items of orders/invoices that reference
the product.

sales_category.description: The ID of the sales category that the product belongs to.

track_inventory.description: Flag that specifies if inventory (per storage location) is tracked for the product.

manufacturer.description: The name of the manufacturer of the product.

require_lot_for_sales_fulfillment.description:
Flag indicating whether a lot must be specified when a sales is fulfilled.

When TRUE, a lot must be specified in the register (for OTC sales) or during
pickup/delivery fulfillment.

lot_configuration.description:
Defines that the product uses lots and provides the settings on how
lots are used.

* `UPC` - Universal Product Code (UPC) - is a barcode symbology (i.e., a specific type of barcode) that is widely used in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Australia, New Zealand, and in other countries for tracking trade items in stores.

value.description:
The value of the identifier.
Note that the type imposes constraints on the value, for example a GTIN is between 8 and 14 characters long.

items.description: An identifier for a product. Consists of type and value.

tax_category.description:
Represents the locale-independent representation of a specific type of tax.

The category does not represent a specifix tax. This is needed as taxes are a) different depending
on country (and sometimes even within a single country) and b) tax rates may change over time but
the actual Tax objects must not change as they are referenced by existing invoices.

For example, the tax category STANDARD is mapped to currently mapped to "DE/19%" for Germany and to "UK/20%"
for the UK. If Germany would increase the standard tax rate to 21%, the mapping for Germany would be updated,
but the products would still use the same STANDARD category as before.

Additional factors may also influcence the mapping, for example the category REDUCED_TAKE_AWAY normally gets
mapped to "DE/19%" for Germany. But when the sale is flagged as "to go", the category is mapped to "DE/7%"
instead.

tax_exemption_reason.description: Reasons for not applying tax on a product sale.

provider_id.description:
The identifier of the provider for the custom workflows related
to the product.

configure_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "configure line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time the
product is selected in the register grid (or scanned, or
added via search) instead of the regular N4 handling for
creation of the line item.

assemble_product_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "assemble product" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked as part of order
processing every time a line item with the product is
fully paid. This then replaces the regular N4 handling
for assembling products.

cancel_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "cancel line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time an
unpaid line item with the product is removed from an order.
This replaces the regular N4 UI for selection of the
cancelation reason.

NOTE: This also assumes the item will always be canceled
in full. I.e., no partial cancel operations.

refund_lineitem_start_url.description:
The start URL for the "refund line item" workflow. When
set, the custom workflow will be invoked every time a
paid line item with the product is removed from an order.
This replaces the regular N4 UI for selection of the
cancelation reason.

NOTE: This currently assumes that items will always simply
be refunded. No "repair", "replace", or "return" handling
is supported for items with such a workflow.

NOTE: This also assumes the item will always be refunded
in full. I.e., no partial refunds.

sales_price_and_quantity.description:
The set of information defining the price of a product.
A product's price is always relative to a specific quantity of the product.
For example, if a single bottle of water costs 1�, 5 bottles cost 5�.
Additionally, a given price might be including tax or not.
Therefore, the ProductPriceAndQuantity is a combination of a quantity, a price and a "price is gross"-flag.

exclude_from_discounts.description: Whether discounts may be applied when the product is sold on the sales channel. When not specified, the product's configuration is used instead.

Sales channels represent a place where the products can be sold.
Each ProductSalesChannelInformation holds the information relevant for the sale of the product on a specific channel.
When no ProductSalesChannelInformation exists for a specfic product and channel, that product cannot be sold via that channel.

items.description:
A Tax represents a specific and unchangeable tax. Whenever a tax (rate) changes due to new legislation
or other reasons, a new Tax must be defined and used from then on.

For example, the standard VAT rates in Germany have been changed multiple times in the last 50 years:
* 01.01.1968 � 30.06.1968 = 10%
* 01.07.1968 � 31.12.1977 = 11%
* 01.01.1978 � 30.06.1979 = 12%
* 01.07.1979 � 30.06.1983 = 13%
* 01.07.1983 � 31.12.1992 = 14%
* 01.01.1993 � 31.03.1998 = 15%

List of items that depend on this item.

An item depends on another item, if it cannot exist alone. There are different types
of dependencies, therefore each element in the list is a pair of the id of the depending
item and the type of the dependency.

depending_item_id.description: The ID of the depending item.

dependency_type.description:
Defines the different types of dependencies that can exist between invoice items.

* UNKNOWN - The dependency type is not known
* OPTION - The depending item is an option of its dependee
* DEPOSIT - The depending item is a deposit item of its dependee
* CONTENT_COMPOSITION - The depending item describes the content of its dependee
* PRICING_COMPOSITION - The depending item describes how the price of its dependee is determined

external_pricing_data.description:
When the item's price was computed by an external pricing engine
and that engine did provide "external data" as part of its result,
that data is provided here.

unit.description: Represents a currency. Uses the ISO 4217 codes.

amount.description: A Money represents a monetary value (i.e., a currency and an amount), for example "120 EUR" or "2,500.75 USD".

timestamp.description: Time when the payment was performed. Timestamp is in UTC.

register_id.description: ID of the register where the payment was performed.

taxes.description: List of taxes that were applied to the item

items.description:
A Tax represents a specific and unchangeable tax. Whenever a tax (rate) changes due to new legislation
or other reasons, a new Tax must be defined and used from then on.

For example, the standard VAT rates in Germany have been changed multiple times in the last 50 years:
* 01.01.1968 � 30.06.1968 = 10%
* 01.07.1968 � 31.12.1977 = 11%
* 01.01.1978 � 30.06.1979 = 12%
* 01.07.1979 � 30.06.1983 = 13%
* 01.07.1983 � 31.12.1992 = 14%
* 01.01.1993 � 31.03.1998 = 15%
* 01.04.1998 � 31.12.2006 = 16%
* 01.01.2007 � current    = 19%

For now, we only use the tax DE_STANDARD_VAT_2007. But if, hypothetically, Germany would increase its
standard VAT rate to 21% on 1/JAN/2020, we would define a new tax DE_STANDARD_VAT_2020 and use that from
1/JAN/2020 on.

ProductPriceAndQuantity.description:
The set of information defining the price of a product.
A product's price is always relative to a specific quantity of the product.
For example, if a single bottle of water costs 1�, 5 bottles cost 5�.
Additionally, a given price might be including tax or not.
Therefore, the ProductPriceAndQuantity is a combination of a quantity, a price and a "price is gross"-flag.

TaxCategory.description:
Represents the locale-independent representation of a specific type of tax.

The category does not represent a specifix tax. This is needed as taxes are a) different depending
on country (and sometimes even within a single country) and b) tax rates may change over time but
the actual Tax objects must not change as they are referenced by existing invoices.

For example, the tax category STANDARD is mapped to currently mapped to "DE/19%" for Germany and to "UK/20%"
for the UK. If Germany would increase the standard tax rate to 21%, the mapping for Germany would be updated,
but the products would still use the same STANDARD category as before.

Additional factors may also influcence the mapping, for example the category REDUCED_TAKE_AWAY normally gets
mapped to "DE/19%" for Germany. But when the sale is flagged as "to go", the category is mapped to "DE/7%"
instead.

Tax.description:
A Tax represents a specific and unchangeable tax. Whenever a tax (rate) changes due to new legislation
or other reasons, a new Tax must be defined and used from then on.

For example, the standard VAT rates in Germany have been changed multiple times in the last 50 years:
* 01.01.1968 � 30.06.1968 = 10%
* 01.07.1968 � 31.12.1977 = 11%
* 01.01.1978 � 30.06.1979 = 12%
* 01.07.1979 � 30.06.1983 = 13%
* 01.07.1983 � 31.12.1992 = 14%
* 01.01.1993 � 31.03.1998 = 15%
* 01.04.1998 � 31.12.2006 = 16%
* 01.01.2007 � current    = 19%

For now, we only use the tax DE_STANDARD_VAT_2007. But if, hypothetically, Germany would increase its
standard VAT rate to 21% on 1/JAN/2020, we would define a new tax DE_STANDARD_VAT_2020 and use that from
1/JAN/2020 on.
